page.title: 14HURSTWOOD RESIDENTIAL HOMES
page.content: Hurstwood House is a home for l9 handicapped girls over the age of l8. Those who are capable of working take jobs locally. The home is run by a private company but the fees of most of the girls are paid by the Local Authority. Some parents keep in touch with their daughters. 5 full-time staff run the home which has a relaxed and friendly atmosphere and the girls enjoy village life. The W.I. gives a party for them once a year, a happy occasion with a large tea and disco- dancing. High Brooms Old People's Home is privately run and accommodates 22 elderly people, with a staff of 25, mostly full-time. Residents pay for accommodation in single rooms and can enjoy the garden. There is a mini-bus to take them out shopping.
